nodes.text: The Last Tour to Endor was a special event held at Disney's Hollywood Studios and hosted by Walt Disney World for Celebration V attendees at August 14, 2010 from 8 PM to 1 AM the next day. It was held as the last issuing of the ride Star Tours before it closed down on September 7 of the same year.

Special Entertainment events included appearances from series-creator George Lucas; appearances from several characters from the Star Wars saga; participating in the Jedi Training Academy at the Star Wars Weekends resort; doing a Death Star disco; dancing at the Bespin Stage Dance Party; a live showing of Raiders of the Lost Jedi Temple of Doom: A Fan Film of Epic Proportions; Watching the Hyperspace Hoopla; a fireworks show called Symphony of the Stars, and the actual Star Tours shutdown ceremony.

During the shutdown ceremony, a live stage show with various Star Wars characters, including C-3PO, R2-D2, Darth Vader, Boba Fett, and several stormtroopers occurred, and eventually cumulated with Boba Fett blowing up the Star Tours with a thermal detonator, achieved via pyrotechnics.
